title.narrative: F.a: Sustainable comprehensive education response project SCORE

description.narrative: 1. Project: 11917 Sustainable Comprehensive Response to Education project (SCORE) - Phase 2#2. Project area and Country: Adjumani, Moyo, Kibale,Yumbe, Koboko, Kagadi and Kakumiro districts in West Nile, Uganda#3. Project justification: #Declining literacy and numeracy rates reveal that the quality of education in primary schools in Uganda is still alarmingly low. A study by UWEZO 2016 shows that from P3-P7, only 3 out of 10 pupils could read and understand an English story. In rural areas, only 35% of the c hildren achieved literacy and numeracy competencies. The study also found out that 39% of the teachers were consistently absent from school. The low quality of education in primary schools has been attributed largely to the lack of teaching capacity across Uganda. The new Uganda Service Delivery Indicators (SDI)based on independent surveys of 5,300 teachers in 400 primary schools shows that Ugandas schools still struggle with the quality of teaching. A key Uganda SDI finding was that only 1 in 5 teachers ma ster the curriculum they teach. Furthermore, the emphasis on increasing the enrollment rates has exacerbated a situation where the majority of children are in school but are not learning the basic literacy or numeracy skills.#4. The main objective and expe cted results:#The main objective of the phase two of the project, first initiated at the end of 2016 with support from UNICEF, is to improve the quality of education in the seven districts of Adjumani, Moyo, Kibale, Yumbe, Koboko, Kagadi and Kakumiro in We st Nile. This will be done through improved, inclusive and protective learning environments in the 140 targeted schools. The project will support improved district level education management and local governance through local accountability mechanisms. In addition, the targeted teachers will participate in various trainings and be supported through mentoring to promote quality teaching and education. The targeted School Management Committees will be strengthened through trainings and support to school activ ities. #5. Right-holders/ beneficiaries: 70,000 primary school-aged children#Duty bearers: District Inspector of Schools, District Education officers (DEOs), District Education Service commission, Local councils, Sub-county Chiefs, District Planners, Ch ief Administrative Officers(CAO)#6. Implementing partner: Self-implemented by FCA
